title: Ukraine war: Power back on at huge nuclear plant in Zaporizhzhia
description: Electricity from the national grid is being directly received at the embattled Zaporizhzhia site.

title: Leicester City boss Brendan Rodgers vows 'to fight on' - but can he survive?
description: Will Brendan Rodgers keep his job at Leicester City after their 6-2 hammering at Tottenham?

title: Son Heung-min: Tottenham forward revels in match-winning hat-trick, but is he back to his best?
description: Tottenham's Son Heung-min ends his barren six-game spell with a devastating 13-minute hat-trick, so is the 30-year-old back to his best?

title: Tottenham Hotspur 6-2 Leicester City: Son Heung-min ends barren start with 13-minute hat-trick
description: Son Heung-min comes off bench and ends his goal drought with a 13-minute hat-trick as Tottenham punish Leicester's latest defensive horror show.

title: Jack Grealish answers critics in Wolves win as 'ominous' Man City roll on
description: After Jack Grealish scores his first goal of the season in Man City's 3-0 win at Wolves, can anyone stop Pep Guardiola's side winning their third successive title?

title: One-Day Cup: Kent end losing streak in finals to beat Lancashire at Trent Bridge
description: Kent win their first List A trophy since 1978 as they beat Lancashire at Trent Bridge to win the One-Day Cup.

title: Roger Varian has seven winners at odds of 34,838-1 & Summerghand wins Ayr Gold Cup
description: Roger Varian trains seven winners on Saturday at combined odds of 34,839-1, while Summerghand wins the Ayr Gold Cup.

title: Mahsa Amini: Women take headscarves off in protest at funeral
description: Police fire tear gas after Mahsa Amini's funeral as mourners chant anti-government slogans.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: Why the state funeral will be an event beyond compare
description: Laura Kuenssberg will hear from at least two Commonwealth PMs as world leaders pay their respects.

title: Premiership: Harlequins 27-30 Saracens - Sarries win dramatic derby
description: Saracens battle back from 17-0 down to beat Harlequins in a thrilling London derby at Twickenham Stoop.

title: Queen's funeral will be a 'deeply personal event' - Dean of Westminster
description: The Dean of Westminster said the scale of the service in front of 2,000 guests was almost unprecedented.

title: Newcastle United 1-1 Bournemouth: Alexander Isak cancels out Philip Billing opener
description: Alexander Isak scores his first goal at St James' Park but Newcastle remain without a win since the opening day of the season after being held by Bournemouth.

title: Rangers 2-1 Dundee Utd: Antonio Colak scores twice as Ibrox side earn victory
description: Antonio Colak scores twice as Rangers end a three-game losing streak with a narrow win at home to bottom-of-the-league Dundee United.

title: Queen's funeral: 'A small sacrifice to pay' say mourners queuing up
description: People have come from around the UK and further afield to pay their final respects to the Queen.

title: Maya Le Tissier: 'Man Utd debutant can become a star'
description: Manchester United manager Marc Skinner says summer signing Maya Le Tissier can become "a real star".

title: Queen's funeral: China allowed to attend lying-in-state
description: Chinese officials invited to the Queen's funeral are not barred from Westminster Hall, Parliament says.

title: Super League semi-final: St Helens 19-12 Salford Red Devils
description: St Helens withstand a spirited second-half effort from Salford to win their Super League semi-final and book a Grand Final spot against Leeds.

title: I hope King Charles will push for action on climate change, says John Kerry
description: The US presidential envoy says the King can "leverage" the action needed to tackle global warming.

title: Mohammed Bin Salman: Saudi Prince's controversial invitation to the Queen's funeral
description: Human rights campaigners say it is a stain on Queen Elizabeth II's memory.

title: Wolves 0-3 Manchester City: Erling Haaland scores again in dominant win
description: Erling Haaland scores his 11th goal in seven Premier League games as Manchester City brush aside Wolves to go top of the table.

title: Japan storm: Thousands evacuated as Typhoon Nanmadol approaches
description: Hundreds of thousands of people are urged to evacuate their homes ahead of Typhoon Nanmadol.

title: Manchester United 4-0 Reading: Maya Le Tissier scores twice on debut
description: Defender Maya Le Tissier scores twice on her debut as Manchester United comfortably beat Reading in the Women's Super League.

title: Chris Kaba: Rally for man shot by police held at Met headquarters
description: The police watchdog has opened a homicide investigation into the death of Chris Kaba.

title: What now for America's fascination with the royals?
description: The Queen's passing is driving debates over the legacy of colonialism and the British Empire in North America.

title: King Charles and Prince William meet people in lying-in-state queue
description: They made a surprise appearance in Lambeth to speak to those queuing to pay respects to the Queen.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: Football Focus pay tribute to the UK's longest-serving monarch
description: Football Focus pays tribute to Queen Elizabeth II by looking back at her connection with the national sport.

title: Telford taxi driver who murdered family in fire refused parole again
description: The Parole Board refuses a bid to free Azhar Ali Mehmood, who in 2000 set fire to a home in Telford.

title: Prince Harry to stand vigil at Queen's coffin in military uniform
description: He has not been seen in military uniform since 2020, when he stepped back as a working royal.

title: 'Our wedding is on the day of the Queen's funeral'
description: After Covid delayed their wedding for years, Christie and Jake are keen to go ahead with their plans.

title: 'We got married after being mixed up as babies'
description: A chance meeting led to Jim and Margaret Mitchell falling in love 20 years after a maternity ward mix-up.

title: Real's Vinicius Jr hits back at 'racist' celebration critic
description: Real Madrid forward Vinicius Junior says 'the happiness of a black Brazilian in Europe' is behind criticism of his goal celebrations.

title: Issy Wong on cricket, climate change and inspiring the next generation
description: England fast bowler Issy Wong tells BBC Sport why she is determined to make a difference on and off the cricket pitch.

title: Pakistan flood volunteer: 'It was like there was no happiness in the village'
description: Waqar Hussain witnessed the devastation for himself, as fundraisers say more donations are needed.

title: Davis Cup: Leon Smith defends team selections after Great Britain lose to Netherlands
description: Great Britain's Davis Cup captain Leon Smith defends his team selections after the hosts fail to qualify for the knockout stage.

title: Queen Elizabeth II's special connection with Windsor Great Park
description: The Queen's association with Windsor Great Park began in the 1930s when her family moved to Windsor.

title: Emma Hayes on how she led Chelsea to WSL domination over 10 years
description: BBC Sport speaks to Emma Hayes about her 10 years at Chelsea, taking the club from the bottom two to WSL domination.

title: The queue - and the expert who helped plan it
description: Thousands of people have lined up for miles to pay their respects to the Queen as she lies in state.

title: Infected blood transfusions probably killed 1,800 in UK - study
description: Study estimates 27,000 people were infected with hepatitis C in UK after surgery in 1970s and 1980s.

title: Alvarez v Golovkin III: 'Canelo' vows to stop challenger inside distance in Las Vegas
description: Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez is wary of the threat posed by "intelligent" Gennady Golovkin but intends to win this weekend's trilogy bout inside 12 rounds.

title: Ukraine war: Biden warns Putin not to use tactical nuclear weapons
description: The US president says Russia will become more of a pariah than ever if such weapons are used.

title: Man arrested after approaching Queen's coffin
description: The video feed of Westminster Hall cut away when the incident occurred at 22:00 BST on Friday night.

title: French police nab first-class wig gang suspects
description: A group of thieves stole €300,000 worth of goods from passengers on high-speed trains, police say.
